archetype_name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
name: Extra-Hot Habanero Fish over Spanish Rice with Charred Corn-Jalapeño Salsa
description: Crispy, spicy fish glazed with habanero sauce over fluffy Spanish rice, topped with a fiery corn-jalapeño salsa. Built fast with bold Caribbean–Mexican heat.
prep_steps: Pat dry fish fillets with paper towels.
Finely dice onion; reserve half for salsa and half for the pan.
Seed and finely chop jalapenos (leave seeds for extra heat).
cook_steps: Cook spanish rice according to package directions; keep warm.
Heat a grill or a large skillet over high. Add a little olive oil and char corn and half the jalapenos for 3–4 minutes until lightly blistered; cool briefly.
In a bowl, combine charred corn, reserved raw jalapenos, half the chopped coriander, half the diced onion, a squeeze of lime, and a pinch of salt; set aside as salsa.
Season fish fillets lightly with salt and chilli powder. Brush both sides with habanero sauce.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high (or use a well-oiled grill). Sear fish 2–3 minutes per side until opaque and flaky.
In the same pan, add a splash more olive oil if needed. Soften remaining diced onion and bell peppers for 2–3 minutes; toss with a small spoon of habanero sauce for extra heat.
To serve, spoon spanish rice into bowls, top with seared fish, the warm pepper-onion mix, and the corn-jalapeño salsa. Finish with remaining coriander and lime wedges.
